get.description: Get risk analysis model associated with this environment, possibly filtered by some combination of dimension, object, and layout

parameters.name: dimension
parameters.description: Dimension to filter model by.  Permissable value are - all, asset, attacker, countermeasure, misusecase, obstacle, requirement, response, risk, role, task, threat, and vulnerability.

parameters.name: layout
parameters.description: Model layout.  Permissable values are - Hierarchical, Spring, Radial, and Circular

theEnvironmentName.description: Name of the environment these response properties are specific to.

theCost.description: Level of cost for accepting the consequences of the risk given the environment.

theRationale.description: Justification for accepting the risk in this environment.

theSynopsis.description: A synopsis of the architectural pattern.
theSynopsis.example: Model illustrating context specific policy management with XACML.

theComponents.description: List of components associated with this architectural pattern.

theSignificance.example: Unanonymised and in the wrong hands, this data can be very damaging.

isCritical.description: Set to 1 if the asset is critical, i.e. any threat or vulnerability to this asset in an environment maximises the related risk score.

theCriticalRationale.description: If isCritical is set then this description provides a justification for the criticality.

theEnvironmentName.description: Environment the association is situated in.

theHeadRole.description: UML role associated with association head

theTailRole.description: UML role associated with association tail

theRationale.description: Design rationale for this asset association
theRationale.example: Workflows contain one or more pieces of clinical data

theProperties.description: The security properties of the asset that need to be protected in this environment.

theAssociations.description: associations associated with this asset, where the asset is the head of the qssociation.

theImage.description: Name of the attacker avatar image file.  This should be in the CAIRIS server's image directory.

theDescription.example: Carol is a freelance journalist working in the South East of England.  Having heard stories about data theft, she is currently investigating a number of e-Science projects, including NeuroGrid, to see if she can find a story.

theEnvironmentName.description: Name of the environment the attacker is situated in.

theReferenceName.description: Name of the reference that forms the basis of this characteristic reference.

theCharacteristicType.description: Indicates whether this reference contributes to a characteristic's grounds, warrant, or rebuttal.

theReferenceDescriptoin.description: Extract from the source text, concept or elaborated information that justifies this reference's basis as a ground, warrant, or rebuttal.
theReferenceDescriptoin.example: ... the webinos system determines the current context of device A, and finds a device B in the immediate vicinity...

theDimensionName.description: The type of reference.  For document references, this will be 'document'.  For concept references, this will be one of the other values.

theRequirements.description: Names of template requirements that specify the component's functionality or qualities.

theGoals.description: Names of the template goals that specify the component's functionality of qualities.

theGoalAssociations.description: Associations between template goals associated with this component.

theGoalName.description: Name of head template goal in association.

theSubGoalName.description: Name of tail template goal in association.

theHeadAsset.description: Name of template asset at the head of the association

theHeadAdornment.description: Type of template asset association at the head end of the association

theHeadNav.description: Indicates (1) whether head template asset visible to the tail template asset.

theHeadRole.description: Indicates the role associated with the head end of the association.

theTailRole.description: Indicates the role associated with the tail end of the association.

theTailNav.description: Indicates (1) whether tail template asset visible to the head template asset.

theTailAdornment.description: Type of template asset association at the tail end of the association

theTailAsset.description: Name of template asset at the tail end of the association.

theObjName.example: Installation and update of webinos application.

theDescription.description: Extract from the concept that forms the basis of the concept reference.

theSource.description: The asset name at the head end of the associated asset association

theSourceNry.description: The multiplicity at the head end of the associated asset association.

theLinkVerb.description: The verb characterising the association role

theTargetNry.description: The multiplicity at the tail end of associated asset association.

theTarget.description: The asset name at the tail end of the associated asset association.

theFromComponent.description: Name of the component on the from end of the connector

theFromRole.description: The role played by the component on the from end of the connector

theFromInterface.description: Name of the interface used by the component on the from end of the connector

theToComponent.description: Name of the component on the to end of the connector

theToInterface.description: Name of the interface used by the component on the to end of the connector

theToRole.description: The role played by the component on the to end of the connector

theProtocol.description: The protocol used by the connector

theDescription.example: X.509 certificates extended to tie client workstations so NeuroGrid tasks can only be carried out on these.

theEnvironmentName.description: Name of the environment these countermeasure properties are specific to.

theCost.description: Level of cost of the countermeasure to the roles responsible for it in this environment.

thePersonas.description: The impact of the countermeasure on personas and tasks in the environment.

theProperties.description: The security properties fostered as a result of this countermeasure's presence in the environment.

theRequirements.description: The name of the requirements that specify or constrain the countermeasure in this environment.  These requirements are refinements of goals originating from risk responses.

theRoles.description: The name of the roles with responsibility for the countermeasure in this environment.

theTargets.description: Details of how the countermeasure target's the associated risk's threat or vulnerability in this environment.

theName.description: Name of the threat or vulnerability targeted by the countermeasure.

theEffectiveness.description: An indication of how effective the countermeasure is at treating the target.

theRationale.description: Justification for the target effectiveness value.

theEnvironmentName.description: Environment this data flow is specific to.

theFromType.description: The type of DFD element data flows from in this environment.

theFromName.description: The name of the DFD element data flows from in this environment.

theToType.description: The type of DFD element data flows to in this environment.

theToName.description: The name of the DFD element data flows to in this environment.

theAssets.description: The name of assets carried by the data flow in this environment.

theRationale.example: Cannot upload trial data without the appropriate access controls being set.

theEnvironmentName.description: The environment this dependency relationship is specific to.

theDepender.description: The name of the role that requires the dependency.

theDependee.description: The name of the role that provides the dependency.

theDependency.description: The asset, goal, or task dependency itself.

theDocName.description: Name of the associated external document

theContributor.description: Name of the person who elicited or contributed this document reference.

theExcerpt.description: Extract from the external document that forms the basis of the document reference.
theExcerpt.example: AJS indicates how many jobs you have.

theDescription.example: NeuroGrid API users have a working knowledge of the NeuroGrid infrastructure, and the security mechanisms used by it.

The exemplar aims to integrate large existing datasets of serial MRI scans and behaviour data coupled to the NeuroGrid image analysis service into a Grid-based database, test image normalisation techniques, and develop a general ontology for a psychosis databas, for use in multi-centre studies.

theEnvironments.description: A list of environments within this environment.  Relevant only if this is a composite environment

theOverridingEnvironment.description: If this is a composite environment and the the duplicate property is set to override then this will be name of the environment that environment specific properties will overriden for.  If it isn't then this value will be blank.

theTensions.description: Positive or negative tensions between security and privacy properties.

base_attr_id.description: Security property indicator (0 - Confidentiality, 1 - Integrity, 2 - Availability, 3 - Accountability)

attr:id.description: Privacy property indicator (4 - Anonyimity, 5 - Pseudonymity, 6 - Unobservability, 7 - Unlinkability)

value.description: Indicator of whether the security/privacy tensions are positive (1) or negative (-1)

theName.description: Name of the external document source

theVersion.description: Version of the external document source

thePublicationDate.description: Publication date of the external document source

theAuthors.description: Authors or contributors to the external document source

name.description: Name of image file to be created

overwrite.description: Indicates (1) if this model overwrites existing data on import

type.description: Type of model file being imported

urlenc_file_contents.description: Contents of model file being imported.

theOriginator.description: The goal's author or originating source

example.theDefinition: Anonymise clinical data to remove as many of the traceability links between the data and the volunteer or patient as possible.
Anonymise clinical data to remove as many of the traceability links between the data and the volunteer or patient as possible.

theCategory.description: Type of goal in the specific environment

theEndName.description: The object name at the end of the refinement relationship

theEndType.description: The type of object at the end of the refinement relationship.  The range of values available will depend on whether we are working with a goal or an obstacle, and whether the end is the goal or sub-goal end of the refinement association.

theRefType.description: The type of refinement relationship.  The range of values available will depend on whether we are working with a goal or an obstacle, and whether the end is the goal or sub-goal end of the refinement association.

isAlternate.description: Indicates whether this goal or obstacle affords a goal/obstacle tree for an alternative possibility for satisfying the parent goal or obstacle.

theRationale.description: The justification for this goal or obstacle refinement.

theDetectionPoint.description: Indicates whether this response detects the risk before, at the time, or after a risk occurs in the environment.  Before/At/After values are relevant only if the response type is Detect.

theObjectName.description: THe name of the dependent object

example.theDefinition: Fraudulant attempt to gain access to clinical data.

theTailAsset.description: Name of template asset at the tail end of the association.

theActivities.description: Activities carried out by the persona.
theActivities.example: Claire is a clinical researcher within the Psychosis exemplar.  She is responsible for a group which is developing and testing processing pipelines for harmonising MRI images from different centres.\n\nClaire authorises requests that other members of her group make for accessing NeuroGrid, and is officially responsible for making sure her colleagues aren't misusing their access.  In practice, however, she delegates much of her responsibility to one of her more security-knowledgeable colleagues.

theAttitudes.example:
Claire feels that NeuroGrid has a lot to offer her research but, right now, its hard to see the benefits for the usability problems she faces.

Although Claire appreciates the importance of security and the confidentialty of her research subjects, authorising colleague requests for data access and liasing with the infrastructure team is a time consuming process which isn't helping her get any research done.

Claire is also perplexed at why security could cause simple workflows take such a long time to run, but she also remembers how long it used to take to get data before NeuroGrid so she can live with the performance issues.

theAptitudes.example:
Claire and her colleagues follow a set of processes and guidelines when working with data uploaded to NeuroGrid.

Because obtaining data is an expensive business, Claire also tries to reuse data and analysis as much as possible, and as far as her ethics clearance allows.

theMotivations.example: Besides her research, Claire's primary security concerns are centered around the datasets she maintains, and making sure her colleagues and collaborators can access the data they need.

theIntrinsic.description: Persona properties related to intrinsic trust.

theContextual.description: Persona properties related to contextual trust.

example.theReferenceDescription: Description:  For example notifications could be sent to parents in case that their child leaves a dedicated area (e.g. leaving Berlin - something must be wrong).

theDemands.description: Indication of the demands placed on the persona completing the task in this environment.

theDuration.description: An indication of the time taken by the persona to complete the task in this environment.

theFrequency.description: An indication of how frequently the persona completes the task in this environment.

theGoalConflict.description: An indication of the conflicts faced by the persona between the task and other goals in this environment.

theEnvironmentName.description: Name of the environment these persona properties are specific to.

theDirectFlag.description: Indicates (True) if the persona directly uses the system in the specific environment.

theRoles.description: Names of the roles fulfilled by the persona in the specific environment.

theNarrative.description: Information about the persona specific to the environment.

richPicture.description: Name of the rich picture file.  This should be in the CAIRIS server's image directory.  Set to blank if not defined.

projectScope.example: All ICT infrastructure in support of Enterprise SCADA, Telemetry and Control Systems indicated in the rich picture.

example.EnterpriseSCADA: Enterprise SCADA system currently being deployed to support the Advanced Digester project.
example.TMS: A family of products for providing continuous monitoring of the asset estate.

projectGoals.example: To provide a secure operating environment for SCADA, Telemetry and Control Systems associated with assets owned and operated by ACME.

projectBackground.example:
The security of the environment around Control Systems, operational personnel, sites, assets, activities, information, technological resources, and services has taken on increased importance at ACME Water for the following reasons:

* The disappearing network boundary: a highly mobile workforce works on assets and systems deployed over a diverse and challenging geographic terrain.  Information Technology enables this but, in doing so, needs to provide controlled access to core applications, allowing multiple protocols access through the perimeter, reducing perimeter controls, allowing partners to deliver contractual obligations on time and to cost.

* The business climate is highly regulated, and delivery of Wastewater and Cleanwater services are critical to our customers.  It is imperative ACME employees are made aware of the importance of protecting our assets, information, and reputation to meet this end.

* Law requires companies to institute reasonable, effective and consistent controls designed to prevent the disclosure and falsification of information, the safety of personnel, sites, and the protection of technological resources.

* Rapid changes face ACME in the use and dependence of computers and network technologies.  It is necessary and reasonable to expect everyone to apply the proper methods of handling and safeguarding information, and managing computer and network resources.

theContribution.description: The positive or negative contribution made.

theMeansEnd.description: Indicates whether this element is the means or end of the contribution relationship.

theActor.description: The actor the associated goal or soft goal will be within the boundary of.

theDimension.description: Indicates whether the associated element will be a goal or softgoal.

theSynopsis.description: Synopsis of the related document or concept reference expressed in intentional terms.  Blank if this synposis is not set.

theName.description: Short name synopsis of the requirement

theLabel.description: Numeric label associated with the requirement's asset or environment

theDescription.example: Applications shall be isolated from each other.

theOriginator.description: The requirement's author or originating source.

theFitCriterion.description: Fit criterion which, if satisfied, validates the requirement.
theFitCriterion.example: Application are unable to view or modify another application's data or execution state.

accept.description: Environment-specific response properties when risk is accepted.

mitigate.description: Environment-specific response properties when risk is mitigated.

transfer.description: Environment-specific response properties when risk is transferred.

theVulnerabilityName.description: The name of the vulnerability exploited by this risk.

theThreatName.description: The name of the threat leveraged by this risk.

RiskRating.description: Qualitative rating of the risk based on threat likelihood and vulnerability severity.  Automatically generated and read-only.

environment.description: Environment associated with this risk's rating

theDescription.example: Authorises access requests for NeuroGrid and responsible for day-to-day administration.

rationale.example: Researchers very worried about the disclosure of partially anonymised patient data.

theConcernAssociations.description: Associations between template assets that exist because of this pattern.

theProblem.description: The problem this security pattern is design to address.
theProblem.example: Some hosts on other networks may try to attack the local network through their IP-level payloads.  We also need to communicate with other networks, so isolating our network is not an option.  The protection mechanism should reflect the security policies of the organisation, and any protection mechanism should be transparent to the user.

theSolution.description: A description of how this security pattern acts a solution to the problem.
theSolution.example: A Packet Filter Firewall intercepts all traffic coming and going from a port P and inspects its packets.  Those coming from or going to mistrusted addresses are rejected

theRequirements.description: The template requirements that specify or constrain the security pattern's behaviour.

example.theRationale: Defines organisational policy for network access.
example.theDescription: The Organisational Security Policy shall be modelled as a set of access rules.

example.theFitCriterion: Design documentation of deployment should closely match a reference security architecture.
example.theRationale: Avoids introduction of vulnerabilities due to inappropriate firewall application.
example.theDescription: The Packet Filter Firewall shall be configured according to a standard security architecture.

theContext.description: Describes the context to the problem the security pattern addresses.
theContext.example: Computer systems on a local network connected to the Internet and to other networks with different levels of trust.  A host in a local network receives and sends traffic to other networks.  This traffic has several layers or levels.  THe most basic level is the IP level, made up of packets consisting of headers and bodies (payloads).  The headers include the source and destination addresses as well as other routing information, while the bodies include the message payloads.

theValue.description: Numeric value feeding into the summary graph

isAssumption.description: Indicates (1) whether this task is based on assumption data or not.

example.theDependencies: Permission to login to NeuroGrid.  Permission to download data. Acknowledgement has been sent that results are available for download.
example.theNarrative: After NeuroGrid finishes executing a workflow, checks are run on the data to ensure that the results have been anonymised.  When these checks indicate that the results have been sanitised, a message is sent to Claire, the workflow submitter, that the workflow results are available for download.  On receiving this message, Claire logs into NeuroGrid and downloads the results to her personal area.

example.theDependencies: Permission to login to NeuroGrid.  Permission to download data. Acknowledgement has been sent that results are available for download.
example.theNarrative: After NeuroGrid finishes executing a workflow, a message is sent to Tom, the workflow submitter, that the workflow results are available for download.  On receiving this message, Tom logs into NeuroGrid and downloads the results to his personal area.

theTaskName.description: Name of the task associated with this characteristic

theModQual.description: Modal qualifier that indicates how much confidence there is in the characteristic.

theCharacteristic.example: Constructs coarse grained policy from fine-grained rules

theGrounds.description: Grounds for the argument justifying the task characteristic.

example.theReferenceName: Editors support fine and coarse grained policy editing
Keeps work and personal life separate in her online identities
example.theReferenceDescription: She has many online identities, but likes to keep her work and personal life separate

theWarrant.description: Warrant for the argument justifying the task characteristic.

example.theReferenceName: Has a second privacy policy for not being observable
example.theReferenceDescription: She configures a new policy in webinos that will not keep records of what she is doing and where she is going, and will keep her devices hidden from nearby networks.  She can switch to this policy very easily, and does so whenever she feels she would like greater unobservability.

theBacking.description: List of reference names that act as backing to the warrant elements.
example: Manageable privacy policies across the application lifecycle User Story

theRebuttal.description: Rebuttal for the argument justifying the task characteristic.

theEnvironmentName.description: Name of environment the task properties are specific to.

theAssets.description: The names of assets associated with the task in this environment.

theBenefits.description: The benefits associated with this task in this environment.

theConcernAssociations.description: Asset associations associated with environment-specific task assets.

theConsequences.description: The consequences associated with this task in this environment.

theNarrative.description: The task scenario for this environment.
theNarrative.example: After NeuroGrid finishes executing a workflow, a message is sent to Tom, the workflow submitter, that the workflow results are available for download.  On receiving this message, Tom logs into NeuroGrid and downloads the results to his personal area.

thePersonas.description: Summative details on the work impact of this task to each persona associated with the task in this environment.

theDescription.example: Intercepts all traffic coming and going from a port P and inspects its packets.

theSignificance.description: Summary of the template asset's significance.
theSignificance.example: Effectiveness and speed may be limited due to its rule set.  Can only enforce traffic going through the firewall.  Can't stop attacks at anything higher than an IP level.  Performance impact due to analysing each and every packet.

theSurfaceType.description: The type of surface exposed by this template asset

theAccessRight.description: The level of access right needed to interact with this template asset.

theProperties.description: The security properties of the template asset that need to be protected in this environment.

theInterfaces.description: Known interfaces to the template asset.

theDefinition.example: The personal zone proxy shall be the certificate authority for a device enrolled in a personal zone.

theResponsibilities.description: Names of roles responsible for this template goal.

theConcerns.description: Names of template assets associated with this template goal.

theName.description: Short name synopsis of the template requirement

theDescription.example: The Organisational Security Policy shall be modelled as a set of access rules.

theAssetName.description: The name of the template asset this template requirement is associated with.

theFitCriterion.description: Fit criterion which, if satisfied, validates the template requirement.

theRationale.example: Define's organisational policy for network access.

theType.description: Type of threat.  These are importable

theMethod.description: General approach taken by attackers to carry out this threat

theEnvironmentName.description: The environment these threat properties are specific to.

theAssets.description: The names of assets endangered by this threat in this environment.

theLikelihood.description: The likelihood of the threat in this environment.

theAttackers.description: The name of attackers with the ability to use this threat in this environment.

theProperties.description: The asset/s security properties of interest to attackers in this environment.

theFromObject.description: Type of object being traced from.

theFromName.description: Name of object being traced from.

theToObject.description: Type of object being traced to.

theToName.description: Name of object being traced to.

theEnvironmentName.description: Environment this risk response is specific to.

theRoles.description: Names of roles risk transferred to in this environment, and the cost level of transferring the risk.

theDescription.example: All processes and objects associated with plant operations is considered trustworthy.

theName.description: The name of the environment these trust boundary properties are specific to.

thePrivilege.description: Level of privilege that the components within the trust boundaries operate at in this environment.

theType.description: The type of DFD component within the trust boundary in this environment.

theName.description: The name of DFD component within the trust boundary in this environment.

example.message: The provided asset name could not be found in the database. You have requested this URI [/api/assets/name/invalidname] but did you mean /api/assets/name/<string:name> or /api/assets/model/environment/<string:environment>/asset/<string:asset> or /api/tasks/name/<string:task>/environment/<string:environment>/hindrance ?

theActors.description: Names of roles that are use case actors in this use case.

theReferenceContributions.description: Contribution use case makes to social goals or soft goals.

theSteps.theStepText: Instrument Technician requests verification of software change
System sends software change alarm to Telemetry Network
System displays modified software changes to Instrument Technician
Instrument Technician submits software modification report to the system.

example.thePostCond: Modified software alarm received by telemetry network.  Modified software on software repository.  Software modification report on software repository.
example.thePreCond: Software repository online.  Alarm mechanisms online.  Instrument technician authenticated with outstation.  Instrument technician authenticated with telemetry network.  Modified software on laptop and outstation.

theSteps.theStepText: Instrument Technician requests verification of software change
System sends software change alarm to Telemetry Network
System displays modified software changes to Instrument Technician

example.thePostCond: Modified software alarm received by telemetry network.
example.thePreCond: Alarm mechanisms online.  Instrument technician authenticated with outstation.  Modified software on laptop and outstation.

theContributionTo.description: Name of the goal/softgoal associated with a persona characteristic that this use case contributes to.
The social goal modelling element this element contributes to.

thePreCond.description: Preconditions that must hold before this use case begins in this environment.
thePreCond.example: Alarm mechanisms online.  Instrument technician authenticated with outstation.  Modified software on laptop and outstation.

theStepText.description: Description of the step taken by the actor or system.
theStepText.example: Instruction technician requests verification of software change.

theDimensionType.description: Indicates whether a goal or requirement is being obstructed as a result of this exception.

theDimensionValue.description: The name of the dimension (goal or requirement) obstructed by the exception.

theExceptions.description: List of exceptions that might occur during this step.

theSynopsis.description: A synopsis of the step expressed in intentional terms.

theActorType.description: The type of social goal actor this step will be within the boundary of.

theActor.description: The name of the actor this step will be within the boundary of.

thePostCond.description: Postconditions that need to hold after the use case completes in this environment.
thePostCond.example: Modified software alarm received by telemetry network.  Modified software on software repository.  Software modification report on software repository.

enum: Lawfulness, Fairness, and Privacy: Fair data processing
Lawfulness, Fairness, and Privacy: Lawful data handling
Lawfulness, Fairness, and Privacy: Necessary processing

theMessage.description: Detailed message describing the valiation check results
theMessage.example: Integrity of Data node is lower than Workflow.

theName.description: The name of the value type object

theDescription.description: Description that elaborates the value type object.
theDescription.example: Subject needs to be explicitly authenticated to access resource.

theScore.description: The score associated with this value type.  If scores aren't relevant to the value type, this should be -1.

theRationale.description: Rationale for the value type score.

theVulnerabilityDescription.example: Certificates can be shared, allowing unauthorised users access to the NeuroGrid portal.

theEnvironmentName.description: Name of the environment where the vulnerability is situated

theAssets.description: Name of assets exposed to the vulnerability in this environment.

theSeverity.description: Severity of the vulnerability in this environment.
